alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 07 at 4:03AM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Wheeler Creek at Bill Cheek Road near Auburn affecting Gwinnett and Barrow Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Wheeler Creek at Bill Cheek Road near Auburn. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Bill Cheek Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:57 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:57 AM EDT Thursday was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 09/14/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
